      • readBOOLEAN

        public Boolean readBOOLEAN()
                    throws IOException
        Reads a nullable 1-bit Boolean value. Identical to readBOOLEAN(null).
        Returns:
        the read Boolean value or null if the null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readBOOLEAN(Boolean)

      • readBOOLEAN

        public Boolean readBOOLEAN(Boolean defaultValue)
                    throws IOException
        Reads a 1-bit Boolean value. First, a 1-bit boolean value is read for a null flag. And, if the flag is not set, the value read via readBoolean() is returned, If the null flag is set, defaultValue is returned.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to be returned if the null flag is set
        Returns:
        the Boolean value read or the defaultValue if null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readBoolean()

        Returns:

      • readUnsignedINTEGER

        public Integer readUnsignedINTEGER(int length)
                            throws IOException
        Reads a nullable length-bit unsigned Integer value. Identical to readUnsignedINTEGER(length, null).
        Parameters:
        length - bit length; See readUnsignedInt(int) for valid range.
        Returns:
        the read Integer or null if the null flag is set.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedINTEGER(int, Integer)

      • readUnsignedINTEGER

        public Integer readUnsignedINTEGER(int length,
                          Integer defaultValue)
                            throws IOException
        Reads a nullable length-bit unsigned Integer value. First, a 1-bit boolean is read for a null flag. And, if the flag is not set, the value of readUnsignedInt(int) with length is returned. If the flag is set, the defaultValue is returned. This method doesn't check the defaultValue's validity.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length. See readUnsignedInt(int) for valid range.
        defaultValue - the defaultValue returned if the null flag is set
        Returns:
        the Integer value or defaultValue if the null flag is set.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedInt(int)

        Returns:
        a unsigned int value read from the input.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

        public Integer readINTEGER(int length)
                    throws IOException

        Returns:

      • readINTEGER

                  Integer defaultValue)
                    throws IOException
        Reads a nullable length-bit signed Integer value. First, a 1-bit boolean is read for a null flag. And, if the flag is not set, the value of readInt(int) is returned. If the flag is set, the defaultValue is returned.
        Parameters:
        length - bit length. See readInt(int) for valid range. (inclusive)
        defaultValue - the defaultValue returned if the null flag is set
        Returns:
        the read Integer value or defaultValue if the null flag is set.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readUnsignedLONG

        public Long readUnsignedLONG(int length,
                    Long defaultValue)
                      throws IOException
        Reads a nullable length-bit unsigned Long value. First, a 1-bit boolean value is read for a null flag. And, if the null flag is not set, a value read via readUnsignedLong(int) is returned. If the null flag is set, the defaultValue is returned. This method doesn't check the defaultValue's validity.
        Parameters:
        length - the bit length; See readUnsignedLong(int) for valid range.
        defaultValue - the default value returned if the null flag is set
        Returns:
        the Long value or the defaultValue if null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readUnsignedLong(int)

        Parameters:

      • readBytes

        public final byte[] readBytes()
                       throws IOException
        Reads a non-null byte array. First, a 31-bit unsigned integer is read for the byte count. And each byte is read.
        Returns:
        read byte array
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readBYTES

        public final byte[] readBYTES(byte[] defaultValue)
                       throws IOException
        Reads a nullable byte array. First, a 1-bit boolean is read for a null flag. And, if the null flag is not set, the value read via readBytes() is returned. If the null flag is set, the defaultValue is returned.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to be returned if the null flag is set.
        Returns:
        a byte array or defaultValue if the null flag set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readBytes()

      • readASCII

        public final String readASCII()
                       throws IOException
        Reads a nullable 7-bit ASCII String. Identical to readASCII(null).
        Returns:
        the ASCII String or null if the null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readASCII(String)

      • readASCII

        public final String readASCII(String defaultValue)
                       throws IOException
        Reads a nullable 7-bit ASCII String. First, a 1-bit boolean is read for a null flag. And, if the null flag is not set, a 31-bit unsigned integer is read for the character count following the characters which each is read as a 7-bit unsigned byte. If the null flag is set, the defaultValue is returned. This method doesn't check the defaultValue's validity.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value to be returned if the null flag is set.
        Returns:
        a read ASCII String or defaultValue if the null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readUTF

        public String readUTF()
               throws IOException
        Deprecated. Not for Bit-I/O. Use readSTRING(String).
        Reads a modified-UTF8 String. Identical to DataInput.readUTF().
        Returns:
        a String
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        DataInput.readUTF()

      • readString

        public final String readString(String charsetName)
                        throws IOException
        Reads a non-null String.
        Parameters:
        charsetName - charset name
        Returns:
        the String read.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • readSTRING

        public final String readSTRING(String charsetName)
                        throws IOException
        Reads a nullable String. Identical to readSTRING(null).
        Parameters:
        charsetName - the character set name for constructing a String with raw bytes
        Returns:
        a String value read or null if the null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readSTRING(String)

      • readSTRING

        public final String readSTRING(String charsetName,
                String defaultValue)
                        throws IOException
        Reads a nullable String. First, a 1-bit boolean is read for a null flag. And, if the null flag is not set, the value from readBytes() is returned as a String created with characterSet. If the null flag is set, the defaultValue is returned. This method doesn't check the defaultValue's validity.
        Parameters:
        charsetName - the character set name for constructing a String with raw bytes.
        defaultValue - the default value to be returned if the null flag is set.
        Returns:
        a String value or defaultValue if the null flag is set
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        readBytes(), String.String(byte[], String)

      • align

        public int align(int length)
          throws IOException
        Align to given length octets.
        Parameters:
        length - number of octets to align; must be non-zero positive.
        Returns:
        the number of bits discarded for alignment.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • available

        public final int available()
        Returns the number of bits available for reading in current octet.
        Returns:
        available bits for reading

      • getCount

        public final int getCount()
        Returns the number of octets written/read so far.
        Returns:
        the number of octets written/read so far.
